The kobold [[lookup @name lowercase]] throws a flask of volatile substances at a point it can see within 30 feet of it.

The flask explodes, and each creature within 15 feet of that point must make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage average]] damage of the type determined by [[/item Apothecary]] and is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned.

A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Poisoned.name: 中毒
Poisoned.description: 你陷入&Reference[poisoned apply=false]{中毒} 1 分钟。

Studded Leather Armor.name: 镶钉皮甲
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Pack Tactics.name: 集群战术
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: 日照敏感
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Swarm of Fire Dancers.name: Swarm of Fire Dancers
Swarm of Fire Dancers.description:
A swirling mass of tiny, blue flames dances with the likeness of a skull embedded in each little, flickering fire.

Stunted Elementals. Fire dancers are tiny fire elementals. Speculation varies whether they’re simply immature or somehow stunted. They may be castoffs from larger, fiery elemental beings. A single, solitary fire dancer is no more than a semi-sentient spark with a fragment of life and lofty but unrealistic ambitions. In large numbers, they’re a menace.

Unite and Grow Strong. Larger fire elementals are usually content merely to exist on their plane of origin. Fire dancers possess (and some argue are infected with) mortal qualities—they seek to reach a greater potential, which smacks of envy, ambition, and resentment. They realize that there is power in numbers and that, when united, they are a force to be reckoned with. A single fire dancer is no more threatening than a tiny candle flame, burning hot and blue. When thousands join together, though, the result is an inferno. Each fire dancer shapes itself into the likeness of a creature’s (typically humanoid) skull to cause fear in its victims.

Shared Goals. Lone fire dancers have some individuality, and like-minded fire dancers gather together in swarms to accomplish shared goals. Savvy bards, conjurers, and enchanters who summon or interact with swarms of fire dancers know to quickly determine the swarm’s goal and use that to manipulate it. They must be careful to maintain the upper hand, though, for these creatures are surly allies at the best of times.

Fire Form.name: 火焰形态
Fire Form.description:
A creature that touches the [[lookup @name lowercase]] or hits it with a melee attack while within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it takes [[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity000]] damage. In addition, the first time the swarm enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity000]] damage and catches fire.

Until a creature, which can include the target, uses an action to douse the fire, the creature takes [[/damage average activity=xgrECH5ajKzWpXCk]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

damage.condition: If a creature hits the swarm with a melee attack or enters the creature's space on a turn.

Additional Damage.name: Additional Damage
Additional Damage.condition: Until a creature, including the target, can douse the fire

Illumination.name: 照明
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light to an additional 30 feet.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use its [[/item Frightening Visage]], if available. It then makes two [[/item Singe]] attacks.

Singe.name: Singe
Singe.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 0 ft. , one target in the swarm’s space. [[/damage average extended]], or [[/damage average activity=3UwaLMELG25EgPMp]] damage if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has half its hp or fewer.

Frightening Visage.name: Frightening Visage
Frightening Visage.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] rearranges itself into the shape of a giant, blue, flaming Humanoid skull.

Each Humanoid within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can see it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Frightened.name: 恐慌
Frightened.description:
The target is &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Elemental Nature.name: Elemental Nature
Elemental Nature.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Swarm.name: 集群
Swarm.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny Elemental. The swarm can’t regain hp or gain temporary hp.

Water Susceptibility.name: 水体易感
Water Susceptibility.description:
For every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

Foundry Note

Scaling for the Damage activity is available, with each scaling value corresponding to 5 feet of movement. For example, a value of 1 represents 5 feet, 2 represents 10 feet, and so on.

Planewatcher.name: Planewatcher
Planewatcher.description:
The brilliant lasso tightened around the eldritch monster as the faceless winged creature dragged it across a hellish landscape.

A planewatcher is sworn to protect the order of the boundaries between worlds. These angelic creatures fearlessly track down people and monsters who cross the boundaries of the planes and drag them back to where they came from, willingly or otherwise. Each planewatcher is bound to a single plane of existence.

Friend or Foe. Planewatchers are dedicated to their purpose, regardless of morality. Heroes may find themselves beseeching a planewatcher for help to battle an interplanar foe, or find themselves fighting one while on a planar mission. Planewatchers track down trespassers based on the perceived threat to the multiverse.

Unlikely Allies. @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures.Actor.GacMkzjUUpL3lNzo]{Star drakes} (see page 146) protect the Material Plane in much the same way planewatchers protect their respective planes. Because of this, the Material Plane has fewer planewatchers than other planes, and the two beings can work in concert to maintain the natural order of the multiverse.

Planar Sense.name: Planar Sense
Planar Sense.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pinpoint the location of creatures not native to the plane the [[lookup @name lowercase]] currently occupies and planar portals within 60 feet of it, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can sense the general direction of such creatures and portals within 1 mile of it.

Plane Bound.name: Plane Bound
Plane Bound.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to any spell or effect that would force it to leave its current plane, unless it wants to leave.

Word-Bound.name: Word-Bound
Word-Bound.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] always knows the direction and distance to any creature that dispels, breaks, or otherwise avoids the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JQyigMNPiDnGI18b]{geas} of the promise it made via [[/item Planar Ultimatum]], provided the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and the creature are on the same plane of existence.

While grappling such a creature, it can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pxpb2eOB6bv4phAf]{banishment} spell as a bonus action (spell save DC 17) on that creature.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Radiant Lasso]] attack and two [[/item Enervating Blast]] attacks, or it makes three [[/item Enervating Blast]] attacks. It can replace two attacks with a use of [[/item Planar Ultimatum]].

Reel.name: 拖拽
Reel.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls a creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

Radiant Lasso.name: Radiant Lasso
Radiant Lasso.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 16) if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn’t already grappling a creature.

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, can’t tell a lie, and can’t teleport or be transported to another plane of existence unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] wills it.

Escape Check.name: 逃脱检定
Escape Check.condition: If the creature is grappled & Restrained

Grappled & Restrained.name: 受擒并束缚
Grappled & Restrained.description:
The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled}.

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, can’t tell a lie, and can’t teleport or be transported to another plane of existence unless the attacking creature wills it.

Enervating Blast.name: Enervating Blast
Enervating Blast.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity checks until the end of its next turn.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) that can be used as a reminder by the target but does not automate the above activity.

Disadv. STR/DEX Checks.name: Disadv. STR/DEX Checks
Disadv. STR/DEX Checks.description: The target has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity checks until the end of its next turn.

Planar Ultimatum.name: Planar Ultimatum
Planar Ultimatum.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] demands one creature grappled by it to return to the creature’s home plane within 24 hours.

If the creature doesn’t swear to do so, it must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the creature swears to return, it becomes affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JQyigMNPiDnGI18b]{geas} spell for 30 days, which compels the creature to return to its home plane as soon as possible.

save.condition: A grappled creature

Affected by Geas.name: Affected by Geas
Affected by Geas.description: The target is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JQyigMNPiDnGI18b]{geas} spell for 30 days, which compels the target to return to its home plane as soon as possible.

Plate Armor.name: 板甲
Plate Armor.description: 板甲由覆盖全身，且相互连接的模铸金属板组成。一套板甲包括护手、重皮靴、一顶附面甲的头盔以及在护甲底层的厚重的布甲。其锁扣和皮带结构可以将护甲重量分配到身体各处。

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Shellycoat.name: Shellycoat
Shellycoat.description:
Despite being short and squat, this creature’s relationship with a troll is undeniable. The kinship is most notable in the long arms and thick, pebbly hide.

Long Handed and Toad-like. The shellycoat is a warped and spiteful creature also called the Iamh fada, or “long hands.” They are frequently referred to as bridge trolls. Despite being fey, they are distantly related to true trolls. Unlike those tall, lanky creatures, a shellycoat is dwarfish and toad-like, with short, bent, legs and especially long arms with swollen, distended joints. It can further dislocate and stretch these joints to alarming lengths.

Bridges and Pools. The shellycoat can be found in abandoned wells or behind waterfalls, in deep tide pools, or beneath the ice of frozen ponds, but their preferred haunt has always been under bridges. They are most active during nighttime and on heavily overcast days, because of their mortal dread of sunlight. A shellycoat’s favored tactic is to lie in wait under the water, ice, or bridge and surprise its prey. It strikes outward or upward from its hiding place to snatch passersby, livestock, and lone travelers or fishermen. Prey is dragged down to the shadows and water to be robbed and devoured.

Shining Garments. Shellycoats always fashioned themselves coats, cloaks, or shirts of colored pebbles, glass, and polished river shells. These adornments are crude but beautiful and sometimes magical.

Hazesight.name: Hazesight
Hazesight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see through areas obscured by fog, smoke, and steam without penalty.

Sunlight Petrification.name: Sunlight Petrification
Sunlight Petrification.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains in nonmagical sunlight for 1 minute, it becomes &Reference[petrified apply=false]{petrified} at the end of that minute.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Claw.name: 爪击
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) if it is a Large or smaller creature.

Until this grapple ends, the creature is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has two claws, each of which can grapple only one creature.

Escape Check.name: 逃脱检定
Escape Check.condition: If grappled and restrained by the shellycoat

affects.special: Grappled and restrained by the shellycoat

Grappled & Restrained.name: 受擒并束缚
Grappled & Restrained.description:
The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} if it is a Large or smaller creature.

Until this grapple ends, the creature is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}.

Shellycoat’s Fog.name: Shellycoat’s Fog
Shellycoat’s Fog.description:
While in contact with water, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can create a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]]-foot-radius [[lookup @target.template.type activity=dnd5eactivity000]] of fog centered on a point it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it for 1 minute.

The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured.

A creature that enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} and unable to breathe, unless it can breathe water, for 1 minute.

The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Poisoned.name: 中毒
Poisoned.description:
The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} and unable to breathe, unless it can breathe water, for 1 minute.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Amphibious.name: 水陆两栖
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Keen Hearing.name: 敏锐听觉
Keen Hearing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description:
The [[lookup @name]] regains [[/heal]] at the start of his turn if it has at least 1 hp.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

Water Camouflage.name: Water Camouflage
Water Camouflage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while at least partially submerged in water.

Spawn of Akyishigal.name: Spawn of Akyishigal
Spawn of Akyishigal.description:
This human-sized insectoid has a tail that splits near the end curling over its back. Both ends bear needle-stingers dripping with poison.

Spawn of Akyishigal are found in abundance wherever the demon lord abides. He has also been known to send them to his followers if their need is great and the spawn’s presence somehow benefits Akyishigal.

Lords of Vermin. Vermin of all types instinctively obey mental commands from a spawn of Akyishigal. What’s more, these repulsive beings can vomit thousands of roaches that also do the spawn’s bidding. They take particular delight in belching roaches directly onto their foes, but they’ve also been known to use roaches and vermin as a means of cutting off an enemy’s retreat or of hindering pursuit when the spawn itself wants to escape.

Command Vermin.name: Command Vermin
Command Vermin.description:
The [[lookup @name]] can command any Beast with an Intelligence of 2 or lower within 30 feet of it that isn’t under the magical control of another creature, provided the Beast is insectoid and doesn’t have a Challenge Rating higher than the spawn’s.

The Beast obeys the spawn’s commands to the best of its ability, heedless of its own safety.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The spawn makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Sting]] attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of [[/item Swarming Cough]], if available.

Sting.name: 钉刺
Sting.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: 中毒
Poisoned.description: The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

Swarming Cough.name: Swarming Cough
Swarming Cough.description:
The [[lookup @name]] belches forth a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.S0zDrv6lbnwWaz9E]{swarm of insects}.

The swarm is an ally of the [[lookup @name]], obeys its spoken commands, and takes its turn immediately after the spawn’s.

The swarm remains for 1 minute, until the [[lookup @name]] dies, or until the [[lookup @name]] dismisses it as a bonus action.

The [[lookup @name]] can have no more than two swarms under its control at a time.

Cave Dragon Wyrmling.name: Cave Dragon Wyrmling
Cave Dragon Wyrmling.description:
Covered in black spikes, the dragon’s eyeless head swings from side to side. Darkness creeps from its strange, eel-like hide, spreading like ink in water.

Apex predators of the underworld, cave dragons are the stuff of nightmare for creatures with little else to fear. They can speak, but they value silence, speaking rarely except when bargaining for food.

Born to Darkness. Eyeless, these dragons have long, thin spikes that help them navigate tunnels or seal passages around them, preventing foes from outflanking them. Their stunted wings are little more than feelers, useful in rushing down tunnels. Their narrow snouts poke into tight passages, which their tongues scour free of bats and vermin. Young cave dragons and wyrmlings can fly, poorly, but older specimens lose the gift of flight. Cave dragon hide is more like eel skin than reptilian scales, and it grows mottled with brown and black as it ages.

Ravenous Marauders. Cave dragons are always hungry and ready to eat everything. They devour undead, plant creatures, or anything organic. When feeding, they treat all nearby creatures as both a threat and the next course. Alliances they make only last so long as their allies make themselves scarce when the dragon feeds. They can be bribed with food as easily as with gold, but other attempts at diplomacy typically fail. Cave dragons do form alliances with peoples of the underworld, joining them in battle against enemies, but there is always a price to be paid in flesh, bone, and marrow. Wise allies keep a cave dragon well fed.

A Hard Life. Limited food underground makes truly ancient cave dragons almost unheard of. The eldest tend to die of starvation after stripping their territory bare of prey. Their nigh-endless hunger leaves the ancients the most likely of cave dragons to form alliances, especially with allies that promise—and deliver—food. On occasion, cave dragons climb to the surface to feed, but their earthbound, plodding pace leaves them outcompeted by other predators or unable to keep up with swift or flying prey. They prefer tight tunnels where they can ambush and outmaneuver prey.

Edible Hoards and Vertical Lairs. Due to the scarcity of food in their subterranean world, a cave dragon’s hoard may consist largely of food sources: bat colonies, enormous beetles, carcasses in states of decay, a cavern infested with shriekers, and whatever else the dragon doesn’t immediately devour. Cave dragons are fond of bones and items with strong taste or smell. Vast collections of bones, teeth, ivory, and the shells of huge insects litter their lairs, arranged like artful ossuaries. Large vertical chimneys serve as nesting sites for eggs and are popular resting places when a cave dragon sleeps within its lair. Chimneys just wide enough to hold young cave dragons make preferred ambush sites, as the dragons’ tough spikes help hold them in position until prey passes beneath. The oldest cave dragons also retreat to vertical chimneys near nesting sites or within their lairs to die in peace. Stories claim that enormous treasures are heaped up in these ledges, abysses, and other inaccessible locations.

Darkness Shroud.name: Darkness Shroud
Darkness Shroud.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] naturally suppresses light near it. Bright light within 15 feet of the dragon becomes dim light, and dim light within 15 feet becomes nonmagical darkness.

Magical Tunneler.name: Magical Tunneler
Magical Tunneler.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through any unworked earth and stone.

While doing so, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can choose whether to leave the material it moves through undisturbed or leave a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

Poison Breath.name: 毒性吐息
Poison Breath.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales a cone of black, poisonous gas in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type activity=dnd5eactivity000]].

Each target in that area must make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} until the end of its turn.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned.

Poisoned.name: 中毒
Poisoned.description: The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

Tosculi Warrior.name: Tosculi Warrior
Tosculi Warrior.description:
This humanoid wasp’s gossamer wings beat out a soft, droning buzz. Flashing blades sing in each of her four clawed hands, and the air around her shimmers with magical dust. Dozens more humanoid wasps in a variety of iridescent colors surround her, weapons raised protectively.

The tosculi are waspfolk that share the Golden Song of the hive, which unites them under the command of their queen. Each hive has its own song, and most tosculi hives are predatory, dangerous places.

Warriors. Tosculi warriors are overseers of work crews and battle groups of drones, directing activities and relaying commands. Though subservient to the queen’s orders, they are capable of acting independently or following their own best judgment, if necessary. The warriors’ most important role in the hive is procuring live hosts for incubating tosculi eggs. Creatures paralyzed by warriors are brought to the queen’s chamber to have eggs implanted in them, and after a few weeks, the larva hatches, devouring its still-living host.

Crowd Tactics.name: Crowd Tactics
Crowd Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can share its space with up to one other tosculi. While sharing its space with one other tosculi, it has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if the other tosculi in its space isn’t incapacitated.

Hive Sense.name: Hive Sense
Hive Sense.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can pinpoint the location of its hive queen when she is within 300 feet of it, and it can sense the general direction and distance to the hive where its queen makes her home.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and one [[/item Stinger]] attack.

Stinger.name: 诡刺
Stinger.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

While poisoned in this way, the target is also &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed}

A poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: 中毒并麻痹
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description:
The target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned} for 1 minute.

While poisoned in this way, the target is also &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed}

A poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Prepare Host.name: Prepare Host
Prepare Host.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] extends the paralysis on a creature within 5 feet of it that was paralyzed by a [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s [[/item Stinger]] attack.

The paralyzed target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} for 8 hours and no longer makes saving throws to end the paralysis.

The paralysis ends if the target takes damage while below half its hp maximum.

Otherwise, a spell or effect that cures disease ends this paralysis.

Paralyzed.name: 麻痹
Paralyzed.description: The target is now &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} for 8 hours and no longer makes saving throws to end the paralysis.

Lord of the Hunt.name: Lord of the Hunt
Lord of the Hunt.description:
Fey Lords and Ladies

Fey are capricious, mischievous, and often dangerous beings. However, despite their chaotic reputations, they do follow a certain set of rules. These rules—widely misunderstood by outsiders—are codified and enforced by a cadre of lofty fey nobility. Befitting any courtly structure, the fey bow to lords and ladies: eldritch creatures of immense power who rule the courts.

Heads of State. The fey lords and ladies are beings of high station and prodigious personal power. Each rules over at least a great city if not an entire nation. No matter the scope of a fey noble’s domain, in his or her eyes, a fey ruler’s word is law. Outsiders might not understand the edicts and interdicts of a fey noble, but that’s no protection against the harsh penalties that await any who break them, knowingly or otherwise.

Vacant Thrones. When a lord or lady of the fey dies, the court does not remain leaderless for long. Ambitious beings among the fey always hunger for more power and covet the stations of their superiors. After a traditional month or year of mourning, vicious power struggles winnow the weak and pave the way for the most cunning or the strongest to take the court’s vacant throne.

Lord of the Hunt (Fey Lord)

Astride a midnight horse sits a shirtless elven huntsman. His broad chest is thickly muscled and sports tattooed knot work. Great stag antlers crest the huntsman’s head, curving above his rich brown hair. The pale green glow that shines from his eyes obscures the elf’s strong features, and a massive spear twined with glowing green vines drives forward in his clenched fist.

The baying of shadow hounds, the thundering of hoof beats, and a brassy horn note; the Wild Hunt is coming, and pity its quarry. The Lord of the Hunt is an enigma among the fey nobles. His true identity beyond title and position as master of the Wild Hunt is unknown, but he has some connection to the Black Prince of the shadow fey—while also answering to elvish druids and consorting with powerful hags and dryads.

The Wild Hunt. The Lord’s court is the Wild Hunt itself, a group of huntsmen, revelers, intelligent hounds, and poor souls they sweep up in their frenzy. His home, if he has any permanent dwelling, is as mysterious as his true identity. He and his Hunt constantly move between the Plane of Shadow and the most ancient forests.

The Lord of the Hunt’s Lair

If the Lord of the Hunt has any permanent lair, it is unknown to all but his closest confidants. While the Wild Hunt is a thing of beautiful and deadly grace on the move, the Lord’s encampment becomes his lair when the Hunt settles for any length of time. Tents and pavilions house the Lord and his Hunt, and great, roaring fires roast the day’s kills. The hours pass with revelry, feasting, physical contests, and strong drink.

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Lord of the Hunt takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Lord of the Hunt can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • Cry Havoc. The Wild Hunt echoes with an otherworldly war cry. One creature the Lord of the Hunt can see within 120 feet of him must succeed on a [[/save wis 19 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • Encourage Undergrowth. Plants erupt from a point on the ground the Lord of the Hunt can see within 120 feet of him. The area within 20 feet of that point is difficult terrain. A creature that enters the difficult terrain for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a [[/save dex 19 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d8 poison average]] damage and be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by vines. A creature, including the restrained creature, can take its action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a [[/check str 19 format=long]]. The plants remain until the Lord of the Hunt uses this lair action again or until he dies.

  • Mark Prey. One creature the Lord of the Hunt can see within 120 feet of him must succeed on a [[/save wis 19 format=long]] or be magically marked until initiative count 20 on the next round. The Lord has advantage on attack rolls against the marked target.

Regional Effects

The region containing the Lord of the Hunt’s encampment is warped by his magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Game Preserve. Game animals become plentiful within 3 miles of the lair. Wisdom (Survival) checks to hunt for food are made with advantage, but patrols from the Wild Hunt don’t take kindly to poachers.

  • Hunting Grounds. Areas of natural terrain within 3 miles of the lair subtly rearrange themselves to create game trails through even the densest wilderness.

  • Spooked Animals. Domesticated animals within 3 miles of the lair become skittish and fearful. They are more difficult to handle and flee the area if left to their own devices.

When the Lord of the Hunt breaks camp or dies, these effects end immediately.

Huntsman’s Weapons.name: Huntsman’s Weapons
Huntsman’s Weapons.description: The [[lookup @name]]'s weapon attacks are magical. When he hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 14 (4d6) poison damage (included in the attack).

Sure Seat.name: Sure Seat
Sure Seat.description: While mounted and not incapacitated, the [[lookup @name]] can’t be knocked prone, dismounted, or moved against his will.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name]] makes three [[/item Spear]] or [[/item Longbow]] attacks.

Fey Mount.name: Fey Mount
Fey Mount.description:
The [[lookup @name]] can summon or dismiss a magical Fey mount, mounting or dismounting it as part of this bonus action without spending movement.

The mount uses the statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.T1xZTDCGuvMBSq8d]{warhorse}, except it has 40 hp, is a Fey, has the same damage and condition resistances and immunities as the [[lookup @name]], and uses the [[lookup @name]]'s saving throw bonuses in place of its own.

If the mount is slain, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form, and the [[lookup @name]] must wait 1 hour before summoning the mount again.

Foundry Note

An Active Effect (AE) will be attached to the summoned warhorse, but it will initially be disabled. After placing the summoned creature on the scene, navigate to its Effects tab in the character sheet and enable the "Transferred Settings" AE. Enabling this effect will update the creature's statistics as described above.

Spear.name: 矛
Spear.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]  or [[/damage twoHanded average]] damage if used with two hands.

If the [[lookup @name]] throws the spear, the spear teleports up to 120 feet to the Lord of the Hunt’s hand at the start of his next turn.

If he has no hand free, the spear teleports to the ground at his feet.

Attack.name: 攻击
Attack.description: The [[lookup @name]] makes one [[/item Spear]] or [[/item Longbow]] attack.

Tenacious Stride.name: Tenacious Stride
Tenacious Stride.description:
The [[lookup @name]] moves up to his speed without provoking &Reference[OpportunityAttacks].

If he is mounted, he can force the mount to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks instead.

Hunter’s Quarry.name: Hunter’s Quarry
Hunter’s Quarry.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically calls [[/r 3d6]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.55PkbskG5iBZGrgR]{elk} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.lZR4lhNmYSf89s4Q]{boars}, [[/r 1d4]] giant @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.lZR4lhNmYSf89s4Q]{boars} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.hQt3qIahnB1Odb40]{giant elk}, or 1 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.jLPhaBnMtAbB5dp1]{elephant}.

The called Beasts arrive in [[/r 1d4]] rounds, acting as allies of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and obeying its spoken commands.

The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the [[lookup @name]] dies, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dismisses them as a bonus action.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have any number of Beasts under its control at one time provided the combined total CR of the Beasts is no higher than 8.

Call to the Hunt.name: Call to the Hunt
Call to the Hunt.description:
The [[lookup @name]] blows his hunting horn and chooses one creature he can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=sonqBr13bvv92upK]] feet.

If the creature can hear the horn, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} by the [[lookup @name]] for [[lookup @duration.value activity=sonqBr13bvv92upK]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=sonqBr13bvv92upK]]s.

The charmed target obeys the Lord’s verbal commands.

If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to the [[lookup @name]]'s Call to the Hunt for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] can have only one target charmed at a time. If he charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

Charmed.name: 魅惑
Charmed.description: The target is &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} by the Lord of the Hunt for 8 hours. The charmed target obeys the Lord’s verbal commands.

Cry Havoc.name: Cry Havoc
Cry Havoc.description:
The Wild Hunt echoes with an otherworldly war cry.

One creature the Lord of the Hunt can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of him must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Frightened.name: 恐慌
Frightened.description: The target is &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Encourage Undergrowth.name: Encourage Undergrowth
Encourage Undergrowth.description:
Plants erupt from a point on the ground the Lord of the Hunt can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=XEpBI20IgT6Bw4Fg]] feet of him. The area within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=XEpBI20IgT6Bw4Fg]] feet of that point is &Reference[difficult terrain]{difficult terrain}.

A creature that enters the difficult terrain for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]] damage and be &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} by vines.

A creature, including the restrained creature, can take its action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a [[/check format=long]].

The plants remain until the Lord of the Hunt uses this lair action again or until he dies.

Restrained.name: 束缚
Restrained.description: The target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} by vines.

Mark Prey.name: Mark Prey
Mark Prey.description:
One creature the Lord of the Hunt can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of him must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be magically marked until initiative count 20 on the next round.

The Lord has advantage on attack rolls against the marked target.

Marked.name: Marked
Marked.description: You are magically marked until initiative count 20 on the next round.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it.

To do so, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Foundry Note

An Active Effect (AE) is available to activate the AC bonus on the Effects tab of the character sheet.

utility.condition: When hit by a melee attack

Greyfur Lemurfolk.name: Greyfur Lemurfolk
Greyfur Lemurfolk.description:
This furred humanoid glides silently through the canopy of trees, gripping a blowgun. It observes visitors cautiously with two intelligent, bulbous eyes.

Jungle Rulers. These small, squirrel-like humanoids live in reclusive societies deep in the jungle. They are omnivorous gliders, subsisting on fruits and roots, insects and larvae, bird and snake eggs, and birds and small mammals. They sometimes barter with other humanoids for metal and forged items, but they prefer to rely on the forest for most of their needs.

Greyfur Elders. Greyfurs are the eldest and most revered lemurfolk, as much as 80 years old. Their age can be estimated by the graying of their fur, but they don’t track the years. Greyfurs are cunning individuals and command the arcane arts, though they rarely pursue the art of necromancy—a strong taboo prohibits them from interacting with the dead. A typical lemurfolk stands 2 feet tall and weighs 30 pounds.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The greyfur lemurfolk makes two [[/item Greyfur’s Staff]] or [[/item Arcane Bolt]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]].

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The greyfur casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At will: [[/item .O5VYVAmcit2b22wg]]{Light}, [[/item .FGFNg3DbTjOKKRLB]]{Mage Hand}, [[/item .CY5Q5Hsi9jafx9jH]]{Prestidigitation}

3/day each: [[/item .A5k0skRJyZYMG6A9]]{Color Spray}, [[/item .1wgDN8erZK8U4m3C]]{Sleep}

Glide.name: 滑翔
Glide.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has membranes between its fore and hind limbs that expand when falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage.

It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t gain height with its gliding membranes alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

Light.name: 光亮术
Light.description:
你触碰一个大型或者更小，且未被他人携带或着装的物件。在法术终止前，物件将在其 20 尺半径范围内发出明亮光照，并在其外 20 尺范围发出微光光照。光的颜色由你决定。该物件被不透明的东西完全遮盖时，其光照被遮挡。若你再次施展该法术，则该法术终止。

若你将一名敌对生物持有或穿戴的物件作为目标，该生物必须成功通过敏捷豁免检定，否则法术生效。

materials.value: 一团萤火虫或者磷光苔藓

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: 魔法伎俩
Prestidigitation.description:
该法术是一个初级施法者用来练习的魔法小伎俩。你在施法距离内创造下列魔法效果中的一种：

  • 你创造一个立即生效的，无害的感观效应，比如一束火花，一阵风，微弱音乐或古怪的臭味。
  • 你立即点燃或熄灭一支蜡烛，一支火把或一小型营火。
  • 你立即使一个不大于 1 立方尺的物件变得清洁或肮脏。
  • 你立即使一个不大于 1 立方尺的非活体物质变得冰冷、温暖或对其调味，其效应持续 1 小时。
  • 你在一个物件或一个表面上创造一块色斑，或者一个记号，又或者一个标志，其效应持续 1 小时。
  • 你在你手中创造出一个非魔法的小饰品或一个幻术的图像，其大小不能超过你的手掌大小，它会存在持续至下个你的回合结束为止。

如果你多次施展该法术，则可以同时维持至多三个不同的非即时效应，并且可以用一个动作解散其中一种效应。

Color Spray.name: 七彩喷射
Color Spray.description:
炫目的彩光从你指间散射而出。掷一次 6d10；其结果为受该法术影响生物的生命值总数。在以你为源点的 15 尺锥状区域内的生物以剩余生命值由小至大的顺序受法术影响（生效时忽略昏迷生物和不能视物的生物）。

计算受法术影响生物时，从剩余生命值最低的生物开始逐个计算。每个受术生物均陷入目盲，直至你的下一回合结束。法术掷骰的生命值总数减去一个受术生物的生命值后，余数再用以计算生命值稍高者是否受法术影响。生物剩余生命值，必须小于等于该余数法术才能成功影响该生物。

升环施法：使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术的掷骰时就增加 2d10。

materials.value: 一撮粉末或沙子，其颜色必须包含红、黄、蓝三色

Sleep.name: 睡眠术
Sleep.description:
该法术使一些生物陷入魔法造成的沉睡中。掷一次 5d8；其结果为受该法术影响生物的生命值总数。你指定施法距离一点，该点周围 20 尺区域内的生物以剩余生命值由小至大的顺序受法术影响（生效时忽略昏迷生物）。

计算受法术影响生物时，从剩余生命值最低的生物开始逐个计算。每个受术生物均陷入昏迷，直至法术终止。睡眠者受到伤害也会惊醒，又或者由其他人以一个动作将其摇醒或打醒。法术掷骰的生命值总数减去一个受术生物的生命值后，余数再用以计算生命值稍高者是否受法术影响。生物剩余生命值，必须小于等于该余数法术才能成功影响该生物。

亡灵以及免疫魅惑效果的生物不受该法术影响。

升环施法： 使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术的掷骰就增加 2d8。

materials.value: 一把细沙，玫瑰花瓣，或一只蟋蟀

Sleep.name: 睡眠术
Sleep.description: 你陷入昏迷，直至法术终止。你受到伤害也会惊醒，又或者由其他人以一个动作将你摇醒或打醒。

Bagiennik.name: Bagiennik
Bagiennik.description:
With webbed claws, bulbous eyes, and two nostril-slits that ooze an oily black substance, the creature is not quite hideous—but it might be, if most of it wasn’t concealed by a thick coating of muck and mud.

Bathing Uglies. When a bagiennik is alone, it spends its time bathing in local springs, rivers, and marshes. The creature sifts through the muck and silt, extracting substances that enhance its oily secretions. If anything disturbs the creature during its languorous bathing sessions, it angrily retaliates. Once a bagiennik has bathed for four hours, it seeks a target for mischief or charity.

Unpredictable Moods. One never knows what to expect with a bagiennik. The same creature might aid an injured traveler one day, smear that person with corrosive, acidic oil the next day, and then extend tender care to the burned victim of its own psychotic behavior. If the creature feels beneficent, it heals injured animals or even diseased or injured villagers. If a bagiennik visits a settlement, the ill and infirm approach it cautiously while everyone else hides to avoid provoking its wrath. When a bagiennik leaves its bath in an angry mood, it raves and seeks out animals or humanoids to coat with its acidic oil. If a victim falls, the foul-tempered bagiennik often applies healing oil to stabilize them, grumbling all the while.

Acid Oils. Collecting a dead bagiennik’s black oils must be done within an hour of the creature’s death. A successful DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check yields one vial of acid, or two vials if the result was 20 or higher. A bagiennik can use these chemicals either to heal or to harm, but no alchemist or healer has figured out how to reproduce the healing effects. Other than their acidic effect, the secretions lose all potency within moments of being removed from a bagiennik.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The bagiennik makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Acid Spray.name: 酸液喷射
Acid Spray.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sprays acid on one creature it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it, creating a puddle of oil beneath the creature.

The target must make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failure, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is knocked &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}

On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

The slippery oil covers the ground in a 5-foot square centered on the point where the target was standing for 1 minute.

A creature that enters the oily area or ends its turn there must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or fall &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}.

Healing Oil.name: Healing Oil
Healing Oil.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] applies healing oil to a creature it can see within 5 feet of it.

The target magically regains [[/heal average]] and is freed from any disease or poison.

The target must then succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or its speed is halved and it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws for 1 minute.

Urochar.name: Urochar
Urochar.description:
This gigantic crimson leech slithers upright on four muscular tentacles. At the top of its writhing trunk, a great lidless eye glows with baleful orange light, surrounded by quivering, feathered antennae.

Underworld Wanderers. Sometimes fearfully called “strangling watchers,” the urochar are among the most dreaded monsters of the underworld. They have long plagued the drow, grimlocks, and other humanoids of the deep paths. They seek out death and the dying all the way to the banks of the River Styx.

Devour the Dying. Urochars feast on the final moments of those caught in their crushing tentacles. Though powerful, urochars are quite passive. They watch the life and death struggles of other creatures and take action only to drink in a dying being’s final moments from a nearby crevice or overhang.

Immortal. Strangling watchers are effectively immortal. Gargantuan specimens in the deepest reaches of the underworld are several millennia old.

Mind-Rending Death.name: Mind-Rending Death
Mind-Rending Death.description:
When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it releases all the fear it consumed in its lifetime in a single, mind-rending wave.

Each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

A frightened creature takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

damage.condition: If frightened of the attacking creature

Frightening.name: 恐慌之音
Frightening.description:
The target is &Reference[frightened apply=false]{frightened} for 1 minute.

A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Rubbery Body.name: Rubbery Body
Rubbery Body.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s body is rubbery with few bones, allowing it to easily move through any opening large enough for a Medium creature. It can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Small creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

Hidden Step.name: Hidden Step
Hidden Step.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see and takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

Grappled creatures are no longer grappled and don’t teleport with it.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use its [[/item Paralyzing Gaze]]. It then makes four [[/item Tentacle]] attacks.

Tentacle.name: 触须
Tentacle.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 19) if it is a Large or smaller creature.

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has four tentacles, each can grapple only one target.

Escape Check.name: 逃脱检定
Escape Check.condition: If grappled and restrained by the attacking creature

affects.special: Grappled and restrained by the attacking creature

Grappled and Restrained.name: 受擒并束缚
Grappled and Restrained.description:
The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} if it is a Large or smaller creature.

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}.

Paralyzing Gaze.name: Paralyzing Gaze
Paralyzing Gaze.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] turns its eerie gaze upon one creature it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it.

The target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} for 1 minute.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the urochar’s Paralyzing Gaze for the next 24 hours.

Paralyzed.name: 麻痹
Paralyzed.description:
The target is &Reference[paralyzed apply=false]{paralyzed} for 1 minute.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Strangling Grasp.name: Strangling Grasp
Strangling Grasp.description:
Each creature grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a [[/save format=long]].

On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and can’t breathe until the grapple ends.

On a success, a creature takes half the damage and can still breathe.

Foundry Note

If a situation prevents a character from breathing, the D&D 5e rules for suffocation apply. A creature can hold its breath for minutes equal to 1 + its Constitution modifier (minimum 30 seconds).

Once they run out of breath or are actively choking, they can survive for rounds equal to their Constitution modifier (minimum 1 round). After that time, the creature drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and cannot regain hit points until it can breathe again.

However, it is up to you to adjudicate the situation that makes sense for your encounter.

save.condition: If grappled by the attacking creature

Can't Breath.name: Can't Breath
Can't Breath.description: At the attacking creature grips you tighter, you are unable to breath.

Spider Climb.name: 蛛行
Spider Climb.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 可以在难以攀爬的表面上攀爬，包括沿着天花板移动，且不需要为此进行属性检定。

Emerald Eye.name: Emerald Eye
Emerald Eye.description:
This floating, green crystal sparkles with an inviting glow above the head of a fallen figure.

Servants of Logic. Arcane scholars often debate logic with specially created speaking crystals that are based on their own minds, allowing them to ponder topics from different angles. Most scholars create the crystals to work through a puzzling topic, then dispel the crystal’s magic once the topic has been resolved. Long-lived speaking crystals can develop personalities and sometimes abandon or even kill their creators, desiring more than debate. The magical backlash of breaking away from their creators transforms the crystals into emerald eyes.

Trapped Manipulators. Upon transforming, these floating, oval-shaped, pink or purple crystals turn a dark shade of green and gain powers of manipulation. They quickly discover that, though they broke from their creators, they must be bound to a creature to survive.

Shifting Goals. Each emerald eye’s motivations are different, though all share a desire for knowledge and varied experiences. One may be purposeful, using its power to drive its bound creature toward some specific goal. Another might be cooperative, defending its bound creature in exchange for mobility. Still another might be a manipulator, using and abandoning bound creatures as it hops up a political power chain.

Construct Nature.name: Construct Nature
Construct Nature.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Psychically Bound.name: Psychically Bound
Psychically Bound.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] must be psychically bound to a creature to survive.

It loses 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) hp for every hour it is not bound to a creature or every hour it is more than 30 feet away from its bound creature.

HP Loss.name: HP Loss
HP Loss.condition: Every hour it is not bound to a creature or every hour it is more than 30 feet away from its bound creature.

Bind.name: 铐捆
Bind.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses a creature it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it that has an Intelligence of 6 or higher.

The target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] psychically binds itself to the target.

If the target succeeds on the saving throw by 5 or more, it knows the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attempted to bind to it. Otherwise, the target is unaware of the attempt.

While bound to the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the creature has resistance to psychic damage, but it has disadvantage on saving throws against the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s [[/item Compulsion]].

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can be bound to only one target at a time. If it binds to another, the effect on the previous target ends.

Bound.name: 连接
Bound.description: The target has resistance to psychic damage while bound to them.

Compel.name: Compel
Compel.description:
The emerald eye magically compels one creature it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it to move.

The target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} by the eye for 1 minute.

At the start of each of the charmed target’s turns, the emerald eye chooses a direction horizontal to the eye, and the target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its turn. The target can take its action before it moves.

The target can’t be compelled to move into an obviously deadly hazard, such as a fire or pit, but it will provoke &Reference[OpportunityAttacks] to move in the designated direction.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Charmed.name: 魅惑
Charmed.description: The target is &Reference[charmed apply=false]{charmed} by the eye for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Immutable Form.name: 不变形态
Immutable Form.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]]免疫任何可以改变其形态的法术或效应。

Cikavak.name: Cikavak
Cikavak.description:
A dark gray comb flops atop the head of this remarkably ugly bird, and shapeless wattles dangle from its throat.

Dagger Beaks. Cikavaks use their elongated, dull-gray beaks to draw up nectar and other fluids—or to stab with the force of a dagger. Although it requires great effort to call up these homely birds, the magic is surprisingly common, known among peasants and townsfolk as well as mages. Once summoned, they remain faithful to their masters until death. While cikavaks don’t speak, they comprehend the Common tongue and can speak with animals to help their master. They often magically silence the cries of more melodious birds.

Potion Pouches. Cikavaks possess another odd ability: when fully distended, their ventral pouches hold up to half a gallon of almost any liquid. These resilient pouches take little or no damage from their contents, holding potions without ingesting them or even carrying acid without injury. Thieves make use of this ability, directing the birds to siphon up liquids, stealing honey from neighbors’ beehives, as well as milk, beer, and wine. The most audacious thieves send their birds into magicians’ towers, alchemists’ shops, or the local apothecary to seize mercury, phlogiston, and more exotic substances. The cikavaks carry these stolen fluids back to their owners in their pouches. While normally strong flyers, when laden with liquids, their flight is clumsy at best.

Folk Conjuration. To call a cikavak with folk magic rituals, a character must gather an egg from a black hen as well as 30 gp worth of herbs and colored chalks. Cast at sunset, the folk ritual requires half an hour and a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check. The material components can be used multiple times, until the ritual succeeds. The hen’s egg must then be carried and kept warm for 40 days. During this time, the ritual’s caster must not bathe or be subject to any spell effects. The ritual’s feeble magic is immediately dispelled if the ritual’s caster uses any other sort of magic item or casts a spell while incubating the egg.

Limited Telepathy.name: 有限感应
Limited Telepathy.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature that touches it and that can understand a language.

Silencing Squawk.name: Silencing Squawk
Silencing Squawk.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] lets out a magical squawk in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=dnd5eactivity000]].

Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[deafened apply=false]{deafened} and unable to speak for 1 minute.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Deafened.name: 耳聋
Deafened.description: The target is &Reference[deafened apply=false]{deafened} and unable to speak for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Speak with Beasts.name: Speak with Beasts
Speak with Beasts.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

Kikimora.name: Kikimora
Kikimora.description:
This strange-looking humanoid combines the features of an old crone and some manner of bird. A shawl covers her head but cannot contain her prominent beak and clawed hands. Her skirt reveals bird-like feet.

Filthy Illusions. Kikimoras are devious house spirits who torment those in their domain. They delight in harassing homeowners with their illusions, making a house look much filthier than it actually is. Their favored illusions include mold, filth, and scuttling vermin. They love secretly breaking things and making destruction seem like an accident. They then convince the house’s residents to leave gifts as enticement for making repairs in the night.

Brownie Hunters. Kikimoras hate brownies (see Tome of Beasts 3). While brownies can be mischievous, kikimoras bring pain and frustration on their housemates instead of remaining hidden and helping chores along. Some brownies seek out kikimora‑infested homes with the intention of evicting them.

Pest Control. If homeowners refuse to appease the kikimora (or cannot rid themselves of its devious presence), the kikimora sends a swarm of spiders, rats, or bats to torment the inhabitants. Inhabitants in a home plagued by a kikimora often believe it is haunted.

Hidden Home.name: Hidden Home
Hidden Home.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can spend 1 minute scribing a magical symbol on a wall, baseboard, cupboard, or other semi-permanent object within a structure.

The symbol remains until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] inscribes another symbol elsewhere. While within 5 feet of the surface where the symbol is inscribed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use an action to touch the symbol and be transported to an extradimensional space just large enough to hold the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and up to 50 pounds of nonmagical objects.

Only the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can enter this space, along with any nonmagical objects it is wearing or carrying, up to the extradimensional space’s limits. While inside the extradimensional space, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see out as if through a 2-foot-by-2-foot window centered on the symbol and can exit the space as an action, appearing in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the surface where the symbol is inscribed.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is killed or if it creates a second symbol while objects remain within the extradimensional space, the objects are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest the surface where the first symbol was inscribed.

Homeward Step.name: Homeward Step
Homeward Step.description: While within a structure containing its hidden home (see the [[/item Hidden Home]] trait), the [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the hidden home’s symbol.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动三次 [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] 攻击。

House Pests.name: House Pests
House Pests.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically calls 1 swarm of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PcZ0QjIG6bHpffp9]{bats}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.S0zDrv6lbnwWaz9E]{insects}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8ihbbjkaOFTPbI73]{rats}.

The called creatures arrive in [[/r 1d4]] rounds, acting as allies of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and obeying its spoken commands.

The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dismisses them as a bonus action.

Domestic Magic.name: Domestic Magic
Domestic Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast the [[/item .moXJycSEBjYsqkAk]]{Mending}, [[/item .GdQUqlmFdrHpi86M]]{Minor Illusion}, and [[/item .O0nvDUQ1nhljzWtG]]{Prestidigitation} cantrips at will, requiring no material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Mending.name: 修复术
Mending.description:
该法术修复你所触碰一个物件上的一处破损或裂缝，例如修复一条断裂的链条、一把碎成两半的钥匙、一件撕裂的斗篷、一个漏了的酒袋等。只要破损或断裂处在任意方向上都不超过 1 尺，你就可以不留痕迹地修复它。

该法术可以物理性地修复一件魔法物品，但无法恢复其上的魔法。

materials.value: Two lodestones

Minor Illusion.name: 次级幻象
Minor Illusion.description:
你在施法距离内创造一段声响或一个物件的影像，并使之维持至法术持续时间结束。你也可以用一个动作解除幻象，或者再次施展该法术来终止幻象。

如果你创造一段声响，其音量可以是低声耳语也可以是高声尖叫。它可以是你或其他任何人的嗓音，或者是一头狮子的咆哮、一段鼓声以及任何你指定的其他声响。声响在持续时间内不会减弱，或者你也可以于法术终止前在不同的时间段创造几段分散的声响。

如果你创造一个物件的影像（比如一把椅子、泥泞的脚印、一个小箱子等），则该物件大小不得大于一个边长5尺的立方体。该影像不具有声音、光亮、味道或任何其他的感官效应。由于影像可以被任何物件所穿透，因此与之进行物理互动时都会揭露其幻象的本质。

生物用其动作调查该声响或影像时，必须进行一次对抗该法术豁免DC的智力（调查）检定，检定成功则判断出眼前即是幻象。幻象在看穿它的生物面前会显得模糊不清。

materials.value: 一小块羊毛

Prestidigitation.name: 魔法伎俩
Prestidigitation.description:
该法术是一个初级施法者用来练习的魔法小伎俩。你在施法距离内创造下列魔法效果中的一种：

  • 你创造一个立即生效的，无害的感观效应，比如一束火花，一阵风，微弱音乐或古怪的臭味。
  • 你立即点燃或熄灭一支蜡烛，一支火把或一小型营火。
  • 你立即使一个不大于 1 立方尺的物件变得清洁或肮脏。
  • 你立即使一个不大于 1 立方尺的非活体物质变得冰冷、温暖或对其调味，其效应持续 1 小时。
  • 你在一个物件或一个表面上创造一块色斑，或者一个记号，又或者一个标志，其效应持续 1 小时。
  • 你在你手中创造出一个非魔法的小饰品或一个幻术的图像，其大小不能超过你的手掌大小，它会存在持续至下个你的回合结束为止。

如果你多次施展该法术，则可以同时维持至多三个不同的非即时效应，并且可以用一个动作解散其中一种效应。

Invisibility.name: 隐形术
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically turns &Reference[invisible apply=false]{invisible} until it attacks, or until its &Reference[concentration]{concentration} ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the [[lookup @name lowercase]] wears or carries is invisible with it.

Mallqui.name: Mallqui
Mallqui.description:
With skin stretched like vellum over wizened limbs, a desiccated humanoid form clad in splendid regalia emerges from a funerary tower. The imposing figure has yellow points of light for eyes.

Cold Plateau Mummies. The people of the cold, rainless, mountain plateaus take advantage of their dry climes to mummify their honored dead, but without the embalming and curing of the corpse practiced in hotter lands. To preserve the knowledge and the place of their ancestors in the afterlife, their dead remain among them as counsellors and honorees on holy days.

Undead Judges. The mallqui are not seen as malevolent, though at times they are severe judges against transgressors of their culture’s ideals.

Icons of Growth. Through their ability to draw the very moisture from the air, they are seen as conduits to the fertility of the earth. Mallqui also means “sapling” in the language of the people who create them.

Water Hypersusceptibility.name: Water Hypersusceptibility
Water Hypersusceptibility.description:
For every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 2 (1d4) radiant damage.

In addition, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage activity=x10PcqVEr1tkVyF6]] damage when it starts its turn at least partially submerged in water.

Foundry Note

Scaling for the Damage: Moving In Water activity is available, with each scaling value corresponding to 5 feet of movement. For example, a value of 1 represents 5 feet or 1 gallon, 2 represents 10 feet or 2 gallons, and so on.

Xeric Aura.name: Xeric Aura
Xeric Aura.description:
Each creature within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or suffer one level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]{exhaustion}, as moisture is drained from its body.

If a creature’s saving throw is successful, it is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] 's Xeric Aura for the next 24 hours.

Exhaustion.name: 力竭
Exhaustion.description: The target suffers one level of &Reference[exhaustion apply=false]{exhaustion}, as moisture is drained from its body.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use its [[/item Xeric Aura]]. It then makes three [[/item Xeric Blast]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]].

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At will: [[/item .NSEXru9YjI3EgnF1]]{Druidcraft}

3/day each: [[/item .SQYpQQo682HYMpJ2]]{Create or Destroy Water}, [[/item .627KTWngTQtawhaT]]{Entangle}

1/day each: [[/item .kwkmdFiAIXXr3NtK]]{Locate Animals or Plants}, [[/item .YastClNbgLTWvv91]]{Wind Wall}

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description:
The [[lookup @name]] regains [[/heal]] at the start of its turn.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes radiant damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn’t regenerate.

Undead Nature.name: Undead Nature
Undead Nature.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Druidcraft.name: 德鲁伊伎俩
Druidcraft.description:
你向自然之魂低语，并创造以下效应之一：

  • 你创造一个微小而无害的感官效应，并以之预报你所在地接下来 24 小时的天气状况。该效应可表现为一个代表晴空的金球，一朵代表雨天的云彩，代表雪日而飘飞的雪花等等。该效应将持续 1 轮。
  • 你可以立即让一朵鲜花绽放，一颗种子破壳，一片叶蕾发芽。
  • 你创造一个微小而无害的即时感官效应，如落叶，微风，小动物的动静或者臭鼬的微弱气味。该效应只能在 5 尺的立方空间内起效。
  • 你可以立即点亮或熄灭一根蜡烛、一把火把或一处小篝火。

Create or Destroy Water.name: 造水术/枯水术
Create or Destroy Water.description:
你施法创造或枯竭水。

造水。你在施法距离内一个打开的容器里创造至多 10 加仑干净的水。或者，水以降雨的方式在施法距离内一处 30 尺立方区域降下。

枯水。你使施法距离内一个打开的容器里的至多 10 加仑水枯竭不见。或者你使施法距离内一片 30 尺立方区域的浓雾消失不见。

升环施法： 使用 2 环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比 1 环高一环，法术就多创造或枯竭 10 加仑额外的水，或者立方区域的边长增加 5 尺。

materials.value: A drop of water if creating water or a few grains of sand if destroying it.

Entangle.name: 纠缠术
Entangle.description:
在施法距离内的地面上指定一点，并以其为源点蔓延出 20 尺方形区域的杂草和藤蔓。在法术持续时间内，这片被植物覆盖的区域变为困难地形。

在你施展法术时，该区域内的生物必须成功通过一次力量豁免，否则将因为这些缠绕的植物陷入&Reference[Restrained]状态，直到法术终止。一个因此被束缚的生物可以使用其动作进行一次力量检定以对抗该法术的豁免 DC，检定成功则摆脱束缚。

法术终止时，所召唤的植物随即枯萎。

Entangle.name: 纠缠术
Entangle.description: 你因为这些缠绕的植物陷入束缚状态，直到法术终止。你可以使用你的动作进行一次力量检定以对抗该法术的豁免 DC，检定成功则摆脱束缚。

Locate Animals or Plants.name: 动植物定位术
Locate Animals or Plants.description: Describe or name a specific kind of beast or plant. Concentrating on the voice of nature in your surroundings, you learn the direction and distance to the closest creature or plant of that kind within 5 miles, if any are present.

materials.value: A bit of fur from a bloodhound

Wind Wall.name: 风墙术
Wind Wall.description:
你指定施法距离内地面上一点并从中升起了一道烈风形成的墙壁。你可以造出长度至多 50 尺、高度至多 15 尺、厚度至多 1 尺的风墙。你可以自由塑造该墙的形状，不过它必须沿着地面形成一条连续的轨道。风墙持续存在至法术终止。

风墙出现时，所有位于风墙区域内的生物必须进行一次力量豁免。豁免失败者，将受到 [[/damage 3d8 bludgeoning average]]伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。

烈风可以阻隔浓雾、烟尘和其他气体。体型为小型或更小的飞行生物或物件无法飞过风墙。重量轻的物质带进风墙中时将被向上吹飞。对墙后目标射出的箭、矢和其他普通飞行物会被朝上吹走而直接判为未命中（巨人或攻城器械投出的巨石和类似的飞行物不受影响）。处于气化形态的生物无法穿过风墙。

materials.value: 一把小扇和一根稀有生物的羽毛

Valkyrie.name: Valkyrie
Valkyrie.description:
These warrior women, armed with cruel-looking swords, sit astride massive winged wolves. Each of them is as beautiful, graceful, and fierce as a well-honed war axe.

Choosers of the Slain. Valkyries are sent by Odin to decide the course of battles and harvest the souls of brave fallen warriors. Riding winged wolves (use the statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.yGTh874etxUckmAf]{winter wolf} with a flying speed of 80 feet and a neutral alignment), they visit battlefields to do their master’s will, surrounded by crows and ravens. Valkyries remain hidden among the ravens during these missions, acting only when fate decrees.

Love Battle. Valkyries love battle and bloodshed, and their presence on the battlefield inspires warriors to great acts of valor and heroism.

Neutral Parties. Valkyries seldom interfere in mortal affairs, save to ensure the proper course of battles. When duty demands, as a punishment, or when they fall in love, a valkyrie may wander the mortal world.

Chain Mail.name: 链甲
Chain Mail.description: 该护甲由互相锁接的金属环编成。链甲还包括在甲胄下面穿戴的一层织物衬里，用以阻止擦伤并减缓挥击的冲击。此护甲同时还附有护手。

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: 盾牌通常由木材或金属制成，可以单手进行持用。持用一面盾牌可以令你的护甲等级 +2。不过同一时间里你只能从一面盾牌中受益。

Aura of Valor.name: Aura of Valor
Aura of Valor.description:
Friendly creatures wielding weapons within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] have advantage on weapon attack rolls and ability checks.

At the start of each of its turns, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can choose to exclude any number of friendly creatures from this aura (no action required).

Radiant Weapons.name: Radiant Weapons
Radiant Weapons.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s weapon attacks are magical.

When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 16 (3d10) radiant damage (included in the attack).

Ascension.name: Ascension
Ascension.description:
When a friendly creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see and within its [[/item Aura of Valor]] is reduced to 0 hp while engaged in melee combat, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can reincarnate the creature as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.fsPruAIDOg4tVrgb]{gladiator}.

If the gladiator reduces at least three creatures to 0 hp within 1 minute of its reincarnation, it transforms into an @UUID[Compendium.kp-tome-of-beasts-1-2023.tob-1-2023-creatures.Actor.xZwjCq10z1dRNgcI]{einherjar} (see page 156).

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can provide ascension to up to two creatures each hour with this reaction.

affects.special: Friendly creature within the valkyrie's Aura of Valor

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use its [[/item Gaze of Doom]]. It then makes two [[/item Longsword]] attacks and one [[/item Spear]] attack, or it makes three [[/item Radiant Bolt]] attacks.

Gaze of Doom.name: Gaze of Doom
Gaze of Doom.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s gaze foretells a doomed fate for one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=dnd5eactivity000]] feet of it.

The target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Frightened.name: 恐慌
Frightened.description:
The target is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute.

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Healing Touch.name: 治愈之触
Healing Touch.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches another creature.

The target magically regains [[/heal average]] and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

Immortal Nature.name: Immortal Nature
Immortal Nature.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Longsword.name: 长剑
Longsword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]  or [[/damage twoHanded average]] damage if used with two hands.

Spear.name: 矛
Spear.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]  or [[/damage twoHanded average]] damage if used with two hands.

Asanbosam.name: Asanbosam
Asanbosam.description:
A hirsute hulk with bulging, bloodshot eyes perches high in a tree, ready to seize unwary passersby with its rusty, hook-like talons.

Iron Hooks and Fangs. Asanbosam resemble hairy ogres from the waist up, but with muscular, flexible legs much longer than those of an ogre. These odd appendages end in feet with hook-like talons, and both the creature’s hooks and its fangs are composed of iron rather than bone or other organic material. These iron fangs and claws mark an asanbosam’s age, not just by their size but also by their color. The youngest specimens have shiny gray hooks and fangs, while those of the older asanbosams are discolored and rusty.

Iron Eaters. The asanbosam diet includes iron in red meat, poultry, fish, and leaf vegetables, and—in times of desperation—grinding iron filings off their own hooks to slake their cravings. The asanbosams’ taste for fresh blood and humanoid flesh led to the folklore that they are vampiric (not true).

Tree Lairs. Asanbosams spend most of their lives in trees, where they build nestlike houses or platforms of rope and rough planks. They don’t fear magic; most tribes count at least one spellcaster among its members.

Arboreal Escape.name: Arboreal Escape
Arboreal Escape.description: While in a tree, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Disengage] or &Reference[Hide] action.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claws]] attack.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity100]] damage and contract a &Reference[disease]{disease}. Until the disease ends, the creature is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned}.

Every 24 hours that elapse, the infected creature must repeat the saving throw. On a success, the disease ends.

On a failure, the creature’s hp maximum is reduced by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]). This reduction lasts until the disease ends.The target dies if its hp maximum is reduced to 0.

Diseased & Poisoned.name: Diseased & Poisoned
Diseased & Poisoned.description: The target contracts a &Reference[disease]{disease}. Until the disease ends, the target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned}.

Claws.name: 爪击
Claws.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]).

Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t use its Claws on another target.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or contract the disease described in the [[/item Bite]] attack.

Grappled & Restrained.name: 受擒并束缚
Grappled & Restrained.description: Rhe target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained

Diseased & Poisoned.name: Diseased & Poisoned
Diseased & Poisoned.description: The target contracts a &Reference[disease]{disease}. Until the disease ends, the target is &Reference[poisoned apply=false]{poisoned}.

Spider Climb.name: 蛛行
Spider Climb.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 可以在难以攀爬的表面上攀爬，包括沿着天花板移动，且不需要为此进行属性检定。

Fext.name: Fext
Fext.description:
Taut dead skin, adorned entirely with tattooed fish scales, covers this woman’s face and hands. She wears scaled armor, sea green like verdigris on copper, and wields a sword swirling with arcane energies. Her pale eyes stare, unblinking.

Undead Warlock Vassals. Ancient and powerful beings across the multiverse grant magical knowledge to mortals through dangerous pacts. Those bound to these pacts become warlocks, but the will and force of their patron is borne by more than just those who strike bargains for sorcerous power. A fext is a former warlock who has become wholly dedicated to their patron—mind, body, and soul—and functions as enforcer, bodyguard, and assassin. They are powerful undead slaves to the will of their otherworldly patron.

Linked to a Master. Each fext is a unique servant of their patron and exhibits the physical traits of its master. The eyes of every fext are tied directly to their patron’s mind, who can see what the fext sees at any time. The fext also possesses a telepathic link to its patron. The process a warlock undergoes to become a fext is horrendous. The warlock is emptied of whatever morality and humanity he or she had as wine from a jug, and the patron imbues the empty vessel with its corruption and unearthly will. Whatever life the fext led before is completely gone. They exist only to serve.

Outdoing Rivals. Scholars have debated about how many fext a patron can command. The more powerful and well-established have at least 100, while others have only a handful. Where there is more than one fext, however, they maneuver amongst themselves to curry favor with their powerful patron.
